sentences.en: A banquet was given in honor of the distinguished guests.
sentences.cn: 宴会是为了向贵宾们致敬而举行的.
在医学领域的辉煌生涯
漫长而卓越的职业生涯

sentences.en: Elephants are distinguished from other animals by their long noses.
sentences.cn: 大象以其长长的鼻子显示出与其他动物的不同.

sentences.en: He is distinguished for his sense of humor.

sentences.cn: 他是一位卓越的宣传家.

sentences.en: He was cited for his distinguished service in the battle.
sentences.cn: 他的出色战功得到表彰.

sentences.en: He was the most distinguished scholar in his field.
sentences.cn: 他是这一领域成就最为卓著的学者。

sentences.en: His paintings of flowers are distinguished by their rich colours.
sentences.cn: 他画的花卉,设色十分浓重.

sentences.en: His plays are distinguished only by their stunning mediocrity.
sentences.cn: 他的戏剧与众不同之处就是平凡得出奇.

sentences.en: Many distinguished men have emerged from slums.
sentences.cn: 许多名人都出自贫民窟.

sentences.en: She was a distinguished oceanographer, and a gifted painter into the bargain.
sentences.cn: 她是一位杰出的海洋学家, 同时还是一位很有才华的画家.

sentences.en: She was surely the most distinguished queen consort we have had.
sentences.cn: 毫无疑问她是我们拥有的最为出众的王后。

sentences.en: Sometimes formal English and informal English must be carefully distinguished.
sentences.cn: 有时候正式英语与非正式英语要十分小心地加以区分.

sentences.en: The medal bears the inscription "For distinguished service".
sentences.cn: 奖章上刻有“功勋卓越”的字样。

sentences.en: They distinguished themselves at the Battle of Assaye.
sentences.cn: 他们在阿瑟耶之战中一战成名。

words.tran_cn: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
可区别的；辩认得出的；可辨识的
区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章
区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

trans.tran_cn: 卓越的，著名的，受人尊敬的，显得重要的
辨别，区别( distinguish的过去式和过去分词)，突出，区别(distinguish的过去式)
